ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: A deep knowledge of pitch and set class analysis of 19th century music up till the music of Schoenberg. There were a few other neat types of analysis covered but pitch classes were the most prominent.

I learned more about post-tonal music theory, serialism, and various ways of analyzing modern music. Having studied classical piano masterworks for most of my life until this point (Bach, Beethoven, Mozart, etc.), the course marked a natural progression in my musical education.

I learned many new ways to analyse music including set classes and its associated operations, L/P/R operations, uses of augmented chords to quickly change keys, and much more. They were forms of music analysis Ive never thought of and I found them pretty compelling and worth diving into more.

I learned about LPR, more about Roman numerals, 12-tone serialism, pitch classes, and much more! The class kept me engaged in learning more about music theory as well as some music history that added on to the lessons.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: A really fascinating class for people who haven't seen pitch class analysis before. I really enjoyed learning everythingm Professor Harrison and Nicole did a wonderful job of introducing the topic and were both passionate and excited about it.
The strengths included interesting subject material and examinations. The weaknesses included a lack of responsiveness from the teacher and lectures that often weren't well presented.

I liked the material of the course and the instructors way of teaching the material. The only thing I would improve is a little more direction on the homework sometimes and more PowerPoints on the Canvas.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, but if you have the solid theory background as stated in prereqs.
Absolutely! Not horrendously difficult, but still a stimulating music class for those with a good background in theory.

It depends. I would not recommend this course to students who like to seek help from teachers frequently, and I would not recommend this course to students who will expect very thorough and detailed instruction. I would recommend this course to any student who does not fall into the above categories and wishes to learn more about post-tonal music theory.
Absolutely! I think one it would be engaging to those even without a strong classical music background.
I would recommend this course to another student of AP Music Theory or the equivalent level. I liked the course.
